page.title: 02WILDLIFE IN CROWLE
page.content: AT CROWLE THERE ARE COMMON BIRDS SUCH AS{SPARROWS, TITS, BLACKBIRDS, {THRUSHES, ROBINS AND{STARLINGS}.THERE ARE ALSO SOME NOT SO COMMON ONES. SPOTTED{FLYCATCHERS, LITTLE OWLS}AND TREE{CREEPERS}LIVE THERE.{NIGHTJARS {VISIT}CROWLE QUITE OFTEN BUT DONT LIVE THERE.AT THE BRICKYARDS THERE ARE{ {ADDERS}AND{FOXES}.THERE ARE PLANTS TOO , LIKE{SPOTTED ORCHIDS}AND THE UNCOMMON{BEE ORCHIDS}.PEOPLE ALSO FISH AT THE BRICKYARDS.OTHER PEOPLE FISH IN THE CANAL.IN A FIELD BY JOHNSONS LANE THERE IS LONG GRASS WHERE BIRDS NEST.{ {HEDGEHOGS}IN CROWLE SOMETIMES GET BURNT WHEN THEY ARE UNDERNEATH A BONFIRE AND SOMEONE LIGHTS IT.TREES ARE OFTEN CUT DOWN SO THAT FARMERS CAN HAVE EXTRA LAND.HEDGES AND WILDLIFE ARE ALSO DISAPPEARING.
